comments.body: Is there a reason not to? Also, why is that relevant to this proposal?

If the CHANGELOG contains the full release notes including links to the binary(s), what content do we want to have in the github releases?  Maybe just a link to CHANGELOG?
It's relevant as part of the publishing design / location.  I wanted not to focus only on how to collect release notes but to cover the entire path through the release.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +136,140 @@in [CHANGELOG.md](../../CHANGELOG.md).

Is there any reason to continue publishing anything to github releases if
the complete release story is published in [CHANGELOG.md](../../CHANGELOG.md)?

comments.body: They should probably go into the PR that enables the feature by default.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +207,211 @@## Caveats / Considerations

* As part of the planning and development workflow how can we capture
  release notes for bigger features?
  [#23070](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/23070)
